conclusion: Choose the suspension point of the rod as the origin.
For a freely–falling body released from rest s = ½ g t².

premise: The lower end of the rod reaches the level A (upper rim of the cylinder) when the upper end has dropped s₁ = 20 m – 5 m = 15 m.
The upper end of the rod reaches level A when it has dropped the full 20 m.
The interval during which the rod passes through level A (from the instant the lower end arrives until the upper end leaves) is t_A = t₂ – t₁ = 2.00 s – 1.73 s ≈ 0.27 s.
